intro: Hypobathrum rufidulum, commonly known as the red-stemmed buttercup, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features bright yellow flowers with five petals, and its leaves are heart-shaped with a waxy texture. Its stems are reddish in color, which gives it its common name. Hypobathrum rufidulum is part of the Ranunculaceae family, known for its showy flowers and often toxic compounds.
